00161 void SDLLoader::enableLight(glLightingStruct * myLight) {
00162     glEnable(myLight->lightNumber);
00163 
00164     glLightfv(myLight->lightNumber, GL_AMBIENT,  myLight->light_ambient);
00165     glLightfv(myLight->lightNumber, GL_DIFFUSE,  myLight->light_diffuse);
00166     glLightfv(myLight->lightNumber, GL_SPECULAR, myLight->light_specular);
00167     glLightfv(myLight->lightNumber, GL_POSITION, myLight->light_position);
00168 
00169     glMaterialfv(GL_FRONT, GL_AMBIENT,   myLight->mat_ambient);
00170     glMaterialfv(GL_FRONT, GL_DIFFUSE,   myLight->mat_diffuse);
00171     glMaterialfv(GL_FRONT, GL_SPECULAR,  myLight->mat_specular);
00172     glMaterialfv(GL_FRONT, GL_SHININESS, myLight->high_shininess);
00173 }

00178 bool SDLLoader::init() {
00179     //Set the quit variable so that we don't exist when loop is called
00180     quit = -1;
00181 
00182 
00188      /*
00189 #ifdef _WIN32
00190     const char * confile = "CONOUT$";
00191 
00192     FreeConsole();
00193     if(  !AllocConsole() ){
00194         // handle error
00195     }
00196 
00197     freopen(confile, "w", stdout);
00198     freopen(confile, "w", stderr);
00199 
00200 #endif
00201     */
00202 
00203 
00204     //Init paused variables
00205     paused = false;
00206     pausedAt = 0;
00207     pausedOffset = 0;
00208 
00209     //Set it so that it wont try to do a gui if there is none active
00210     activeGUI = "none";
00211 
00220     SDLLoader::pinstance = this;
00221 
00222     // Initialize SDL with best video mode available and degrade to software rendering if we don't have hardware acceleration
00223     if (SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO) < 0) {
00224         printf("There was an error initilizing SDL\r\n");
00225         exit(1);
00226     }
00227 
00228     const SDL_VideoInfo* videoInfo = SDL_GetVideoInfo();
00229     int vidFlags = SDL_OPENGL;
00230     if (videoInfo->hw_available) {
00231         vidFlags |= SDL_HWSURFACE;
00232     }
00233     else {
00234         vidFlags |= SDL_SWSURFACE;
00235     }
00236 
00237     SDL_GL_SetAttribute( SDL_GL_DOUBLEBUFFER, 1 ) ;
00238 
00239     int bpp = videoInfo->vfmt->BitsPerPixel;
00240     surface = SDL_SetVideoMode(width, height, bpp, vidFlags);
00241 
00242     //Set up the default camera behavior
00243     camera = new Camera(Point3(5,5,5), Point3(0,0,0), Point3(0,0,1));
00244     camera->setFrustum(-width / height, width / height, -1, 1, 2, 100);
00245 
00246     //Enable various GL things here
00247     //Enable culling, so that the reverse of faces are not drawn
00248     //If we don't enable culling, weird things happen
00249     glEnable(GL_CULL_FACE);
00250     glCullFace(GL_BACK);
00251     //Faces are to be drawn in the counterclockwise direction, since .obj files are oriented in such a direction
00252     glFrontFace(GL_CCW);
00253 
00254     //I'm not sure what exactly this does, but it's important
00255     glEnable(GL_DEPTH_TEST);
00256     glDepthFunc(GL_LESS);
00257 
00258     //Enable textures
00259     glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D);
00260 
00261     return true;
00262 }

00269 int SDLLoader::loop() {
00270     while( quit == -1 ) {
00271         SDL_Event event;
00272         if (SDL_PollEvent(&event)) {
00273             switch( event.type ) {
00274                 case SDL_KEYDOWN:
00275                 case SDL_KEYUP:
00276                     //Dispatch the keypress
00277                     this->dispatchKey(event);
00278                     break;
00279                 case SDL_MOUSEMOTION:
00280                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP:
00281                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
00282                     //Dispatch the mouse event
00283                     this->dispatchMouse(event);
00284                     break;
00285                 case SDL_QUIT:
00286                     quit = 0;
00287                     break;
00288                 default:
00289                     break;
00290             }
00291         }
00292 
00293         currentTickCount = SDL_GetTicks();
00294         this->idle();
00295         camera->update();
00296 
00297         //Clear the screen up a little bit before we draw
00298         glClearColor(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
00299         glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT | GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT);
00300 
00301         this->display();
00302         if (this->activeGUI != "none") {
00303             //This makes no sense, somebody help me out here
00304             //So I can check the thing: even when activeGui == "none", it will
00305             //go into this loop --- unless I am running the debugger, and then
00306             //it won't. So I put this idiotic second check in to make sure that
00307             //everyone is happy and stupid.
00308             if (guis.find(this->activeGUI) != guis.end()) {
00309                 guis[this->activeGUI]->draw();
00310             }
00311         }
00312         //Swap the buffers to show what has happened
00313         SDL_GL_SwapBuffers();
00314     }
00315     //Program execution is over, time to leave
00316     SDL_Quit();
00317     exit(quit);
00318 }

00369 extern int SDLLoader::getTime() {
00370     SDLLoader * instance = SDLLoader::getInstance();
00371     if (instance->paused) {
00372         return instance->pausedAt;
00373     }
00374     return instance->currentTickCount - instance->pausedOffset;
00375 }
00376 
00380 bool SDLLoader::pause() {
00381     SDLLoader * instance = SDLLoader::getInstance();
00382     if (!instance->paused) {
00383         instance->pausedAt = SDLLoader::getTime();
00384         instance->paused = true;
00385     }
00386 }
00387 
00391 bool SDLLoader::resume() {
00392     SDLLoader * instance = SDLLoader::getInstance();
00393     if (instance->paused) {
00394         instance->pausedOffset = SDL_GetTicks() - instance->pausedAt;
00395         instance->paused = false;
00396     }
00397 }
